trans-unit.source: Provides a type converter for a property representing a data member in a data source.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data-bound control at design time, and is instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
Instantiates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.Converters.DataMemberConverter"></xref> class.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data-bound control at design time, and is instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
Gets a value indicating whether the specified source type can be converted to the type of the associated control property using the specified context and type.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data bound control at design time, and instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that represents the data-bound component or the control that the property belongs to.
The type to convert from.
`true` if the sourceType is ; otherwise `false`.
Converts the specified object to the type of the associated control property using the specified context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data-bound control at design time, and is instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> that represents the data-bound component or the control that the property belongs to.
A <xref href="System.Globalization.CultureInfo"></xref> object that can be used to provide additional culture information.
The value to convert from.
A string containing the value if value is not `null` and contains a string; otherwise, an empty string ("").
value is not `null` and not a string.
Returns a list of values that can be assigned to a control property using the specified context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data-bound control at design time, and is instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that represents the data-bound component or the control that the property belongs to.
A <xref href="System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter.StandardValuesCollection"></xref> object containing the names of available data views in the data source.
Indicates whether this converter returns a list containing all possible values that can be assigned to the associated control property using the specified context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.

The <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.Converters.DataMemberConverter.GetStandardValuesExclusive%2A> method is called by the designer host before calling <xref:System.Web.UI.Design.MobileControls.Converters.DataFieldConverter.GetStandardValues%2A>.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data-bound control at design time, and is instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that represents the data bound component or control the property belongs to.
`false`.
Gets a value indicating whether this object returns a standard set of values that can be picked from a list in the design host using the specified context.
This API is obsolete.
For information about how to develop ASP.NET mobile applications, see the [www.asp.net/mobile](http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?LinkID=182900) Web site.
You typically do not access a type converter directly.

This implementation of <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverter> is intended for use by a data-bound control at design time, and is instantiated with a <xref:System.ComponentModel.TypeConverterAttribute> on a property.
An <xref href="System.ComponentModel.ITypeDescriptorContext"></xref> object that represents the data-bound component or the control that the property belongs to.
`true` if the context is not null and can be cast to an <xref href="System.ComponentModel.IComponent"></xref>; otherwise `false`.
